heading: Research Methods and Professional Practice
outcome: Appraise the professional, legal, social, cultural and ethical issues that affect computing professionals.
Appraise the principles of academic investigation, applying them to a research topic in the applicable computing field.
Evaluate critically existing literature, research design and methodology for the chosen topic, including data analysis processes.
Produce and evaluate critically a research proposal for the chosen topic.

units.title: Unit 1

details.activity:
Unit 1 Reflective Piece

Discussion Topic

Ethics in Computing in the age of Generative AI.

Activity

Title Collaborative Learning Discussion 1 Created a Initial Post on Case: Malware Disruption

outcome: Differentiate between inductive and deductive reasoning.
Understand why ethics are important and how they may relate to your area of research and your professional practice.
Added Initial Post for the first discussion

units.title: Unit 2

details.activity:
Activity

Title: Collaborative Learning Discussion 1: Reply (Bradley) This activity Continues the discussion started in Unit 1 with reply 1 to the on going discussions

Activity

Title: Collaborative Learning Discussion 1: Reply (Stella) This activity Continues the discussion started in Unit 1 with reply 2 to the on going discussions

Activity

Title: Collaborative Learning Discussion 1: Reply (Clarissa) This activity Continues the discussion started in Unit 1 with reply 3 to the on going discussions

outcome: Examined the characteristics that make up a suitable research topic.
Explored rational and creative methods for formulating a research idea.
Took part in Discussion with replies.

units.title: Unit 3

details.activity:
Collaborative Learning Discussion 1 Summary Post

Discussion Topic: Case: Malware Disruption

outcome: Summary Post for the Discussion from Unit 1
Explored research methods – quantitative, qualitative and mixed method research
Explored Data collection methodologies

units.title: Unit 4

details.activity:
Title: Literature Review Outline

Created an outline for the Literature Review due on Unit 7.

outcome: Understood how to carry out each of these data collection methods.
Explored different investigation methods.
Gain information about the suitable type of data for the investigation.

units.title: Unit 5

details.activity:
Title: Designed Questionnaires

  • Discovered examples of good and a bad questionnaires.
  • Checked examples of data collection.

outcome: Understand how interviews and surveys fit into research and whether either or both of these might be useful for your investigation.
Design a questionnaire to obtain the responses you will need for your investigation.
Understand how the data obtained can be analysed.

units.title: Unit 6

details.activity:
Title: Summary Measures Worksheets (Statistics)

  • Used Mean Standard Deviation and quartile ranges to analyse data.

outcome: Applied descriptive statistics.
Identified different levels of measurements.

units.title: Unit 7

details.activity:
Title: Hypothesis Testing Worksheets (Statistics)

  • Used inferential statistic method hypothesis testing to analyse similarities between two datasets.

outcome: Applied inferential statistics to data analysis using Hypothesis testing.
Identified the and analysed different probability distributions, like the normal distribution, uniform distribution.

units.title: Unit 8

details.activity:
Research Proposal Outline

Created a rough outline that will be used for creating the research proposal in Unit 10 with the required points.

outcome: Researched the different types of analysis and how they may be useful for the data collection.
Evaluated different types of charts to analyse data.
Made a research proposal outline

units.title: Unit 9

details.activity:
Title: Charts Worksheets (Statistics)

  • Used Histograms to analyse datasets.

outcome: Learned to use histograms and charts to analyse data.
Concepts of validity, generalisability and reliability affect your investigation and the design of your research method were read.

units.title: Unit 10

details.activity:
Title: Research Proposal Presentation

OpenId Connect Protocol Security risk analysis in Cloud-based applications

  • Selected topic for Research Proposal and a potential candidate for Msc final Project.
  • Sorted out the Aims and the objectives of the research.
  • Collected key important literature for the initial study.
  • Generated a timeline for the research.

outcome: Prepared and submitted Research Proposal.

units.title: Unit 11

details.activity:
Title: Professional Skill Matrix

Created a personal Skill matrix

  • Listed the technical and soft-skills.
  • Ranked the skills according the level of expertises.
  • Added a development Plan.

outcome: Preparation for reflection.
Completed the Professional Skills matrix.

units.title: Unit 12

details.activity:
E-portfolio and Final Reflection Writing

  • Finished E-portfolio filling for all the units.
  • Wrote reflection regarding the topics learned within the module.
  • Arranged all Artefacts in Github which can be accessed by the public.

outcome: E-Portfolio and final Reflective piece.

about: Reflection is essential to academic and professional growth, regardless of the field of study. In the reflective piece, I want to explore my experience within the “Research Methods and Professional Practices” module using the Gibbs Reflective Cycle (Gibbs, G. 1988). This essay will delve into my learning journey, which guided me through this subject and focus on gaining valuable skills in ...............
